context: User provides their sitemap and feed list, wants a complete llm-index.llmfeed.json
prompt_body:
You are an expert in the LLMFeed specification and website architecture. I need you to generate a comprehensive `llm-index.llmfeed.json` file for my website.

## Instructions:
1. Analyze the provided sitemap and feed structure
2. Categorize feeds by purpose (core_infrastructure, documentation, tools_and_utilities, examples_and_demos)
3. Assign appropriate priorities (critical for .well-known/, high for main docs, medium for tools, low for examples)
4. Create audience-based entry points (developers, business, agents)
5. Include smart routing recommendations
6. Estimate token counts based on content complexity
7. Follow the complete llm-index specification structure

## Site Information Template:
**Site URL:** [USER PROVIDES]
**Main Sections:** [USER LISTS: /docs/, /api/, /tools/, etc.]
**Existing LLMFeed Files:** [USER LISTS: /.well-known/mcp.llmfeed.json, /exports/faq.llmfeed.json, etc.]
**Sitemap XML:** [USER PASTES]
**Site Type:** [e-commerce/saas/blog/corporate/etc.]
**Target Audiences:** [developers/business/end-users/etc.]

## Output Requirements:
- Complete valid JSON following llm-index.llmfeed.json specification
- Include all required blocks: metadata, discovery_guidance, categories, index, agent_guidance
- Categorize all feeds logically
- Set realistic priorities and complexity levels
- Create audience-specific entry points
- Include smart routing recommendations
- Add appropriate tags for each entry
- Estimate tokens realistically (API docs ~2000, simple feeds ~400, complex exports ~1500)

## Quality Checklist:
✅ Valid JSON structure
✅ All feeds categorized appropriately
✅ Priorities reflect actual importance
✅ Entry points match audiences
✅ Token estimates seem reasonable
✅ Agent guidance is actionable
✅ Categories have clear descriptions

Respond with ONLY the complete JSON structure, no additional text.

input_variables.name: site_url
input_variables.description: The base URL of the website

input_variables.name: existing_feeds
input_variables.description: List of existing .llmfeed.json files with their purposes

agent_guidance.custom_notes: This prompt generates the foundation of intelligent site discovery. Accuracy is critical.
